availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Archibald Womack (Carter County, Kentucky, farmhand and soldier (U.S.A.))

body.p: Carter County, Kentucky, farmhand and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of William Womack and Jacintha Kibbey Womack. Married to Martha W. Hatchett Womack in Prince Edward County, Virginia, on November 25, 1864. Resident of Carter County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmhand in Carter County in 1860. Served in the 15th Louisiana Infantry Regiment (C.S.A.) as a private from March 4, 1863. to March 15, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, District 2. p. 218A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, p. 220.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boyd County, District 2, p. 22A.
“Archer Womack,” Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File 24376.
Prince Edward County, Marriages. Births, Marriages, and Deaths 1853-1900, Library of Virginia, Richmond, VA. Film #2048470, p. 668.
“Womack, Archy,” Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers Who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 0272.
KYR-0001-025-0029
